description.plain:
One Direction is an English-Irish pop band based in London, consisting of Niall Horan, Liam Payne, Harry Styles, Louis Tomlinson, and previously Zayn Malik. They signed with Simon Cowell’s record label Syco Records after being formed and finishing third in the seventh series of the British televised singing competition The X Factor in 2010. Check out their journey on the competition here.

Propelled to international success by the power of social media, their two albums Up All Night and Take Me Home, released in 2011 and 2012 respectively, broke several records, topped the charts of most major markets, and generated hit singles, including “What Makes You Beautiful” and “Live While We’re Young.”

Their third album, Midnight Memories, introduced a maturing sound. Singles including “Best Song Ever” and “Story of My Life” became smash hits. The music video for “Best Song Ever” even broke the one-day Vevo record, racking up 10.9 million views in 24 hours.

The band’s fourth album, appropriately named Four, continued the pattern of each album becoming more mature. Fan favorites included “Steal My Girl,” “Night Changes,” and “No Control”. The fans loved “No Control” so much that they campaigned for it to be a single, though it was never officially released as one.

On March 25, 2015, it was announced that Zayn Malik was leaving the band. Directioners were left shocked and confused as to why Zayn departed. Fans were originally told that he wanted to live a normal life, but news soon broke that Zayn signed a deal with RCA, and he pursued a solo career as ZAYN.

The boys worked incredibly hard on their fifth album, Made In The A.M., from which “Drag Me Down” was the lead single. The album dropped November 13th and was their last album before their (supposed) 18 months hiatus.
All of the members are working on their own solo careers.

description.plain:
“Perfect” is a song about living for today and loving without commitment. The second single from One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made In The A.M., “Perfect” premiered on Apple Music on October 16, 2015.

Written primarily by Harry Styles, the song may be a response to his former fling, Taylor Swift.

When asked directly if the song is about Taylor Swift, Louis, who also co-wrote the track, dodged the question, stating that it’s “up to interpretation.”

description.plain:
Harry, Liam, Niall & Louis drop their first single without Zayn, and the pop juggernaut celebrates its 5th anniversary in style.

“Drag Me Down” is an ode to someone in their lives who has given the boys the willpower to tackle anything. Alongside 1D’s typical pop-rock, reggae tinges the production.

https://twitter.com/Real_Liam_Payne/status/626983852678877185







Quickly after its release, the single already broke records:
https://twitter.com/spotify/status/628330777395097600

description.plain: “Story Of My Life” is the second single off One Direction’s third album, Midnight Memories. It was released on October 23, 2013. The track has been certified Platinum in the UK and 3x Platinum in the US. A music video for the song was released on November 3.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Harry Styles & Liam Payne]
Written in these walls are the stories that I can't explain
I leave my heart open
But it stays right here empty for days
She told me in the morning
She don't feel the same about us in her bones
It seems to me that when I die
These words will be written on my stone

[Pre-Chorus: Zayn Malik]
And I'll be gone, gone tonight
The ground beneath my feet is open wide
The way that I've been holding on too tight
With nothing in between

[Chorus: Harry Styles & All]
The story of my life
I take her home
I drive all night
To keep her warm
And time is frozen
The story of my life
I give her hope
I spend her love
Until she's broke inside
The story of my life

[Verse 2: Niall Horan &  Liam Payne]
Written on these walls are the colours that I can't change
Leave my heart open
But it stays right here in its cage
I know that in the morning, now
I'll see us in the light up on the hill
Although I am broken, my heart is untamed still

[Pre-Chorus: Louis Tomlinson]
And I'll be gone, gone tonight
The fire beneath my feet is burning bright
The way that I've been holding on so tight
With nothing in between

[Chorus: Harry Styles & All]
The story of my life
I take her home
I drive all night
To keep her warm
And time is frozen
The story of my life
I give her hope
I spend her love
Until she's broke inside
The story of my life

[Bridge: Zayn Malik]
And I been waiting for this time to come around
But, baby, running after you
Is like chasing the clouds

[Breakdown: Niall Horan]
The story of my life
I take her home
I drive all night
To keep her warm
And time is frozen

[Chorus: All, (Zayn) & Harry]
The story of my life
I give her hope (Give her hope)
I spend her love
Until she's broke inside
(Until she's broke inside)
The story of my life
The story of my life
The story of my life
The story of my life

description.plain:
“History” is the 13th track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. The band performed “History” on The X Factor as their last live performance before the hiatus. It is said to be as a sort of song from “the band to the fans”, most likely referencing to One Direction’s hope that their fans will stay loyal during their year-long break in 2016.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B_CIYQLC2kM

“History” was leaked with the rest of the album on November 2nd, 2015, during several early listening parties around the US.

description.plain:
“Infinity” is the second track released from One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made In The A.M., following lead single “Drag Me Down.” The “epic and rousing slice of guitar pop” premiered as an instant-gratification track with the preorder of the album on September 22, 2015.

Julian Bunetta, one of the songwriters, said One Direction is “experimenting a little with different instrumentation” for their new album.

Although some speculate that this song may be about Zayn Malik’s leaving the band, there isn’t much evidence in the lyrics, so we may never know.

description.plain:
This melodic track was gifted to One Direction by their good friend Ed Sheeran for their second album, Take Me Home. The song was released as the second single and reached number one on the charts in both the US and UK.

The song is simplistic with dulcet tones and minor harmonies paired with beautiful lyrics.

description.plain:
“Night Changes” is the seventh song and second single from One Direction’s fourth studio album, Four.

The song was announced as the second single on the 29th October 2014 but due to an entire album leak fans got to hear the song on the 7th of November. It is the last single 1D released with Zayn still in the band.

“Night Changes” is a melodic, soulful track with undertones of nostalgia and backing harmonies to match.

description.plain:
“What Makes You Beautiful” is One Direction’s debut single, released from their first album Up All Night. Lyrically, the song is about a boy trying to boost his partners' self-esteem by proclaiming his love to them. According to Savan Kotecha, who helped write the song, says it was written for his wife.

A music video was released on August 19, 2011, almost a month before the song was released as a single. The track also features a B-side, “Na Na Na”, which was also included on some special editions of Up All Night

The song was extremely successful, topping the charts in the UK, Ireland, Scotland, and Mexico. It also went top ten in Australia, New Zealand, Canada, Japan, and the US.

description.plain:
“If I Could Fly” is the 6th song on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M. Sonically, the song features prominent piano, isolated vocals, and warm harmonies – complimentary to the themes of emotional intimacy and vulnerability as presented in the lyrics.

Much like their previous ballads “Half A Heart” and “Little Things”, “If I Could Fly” is a prime example of the softer, less stadium-centric production the boys aimed to deliver throughout this album. Delving into acoustics alongside a straight-forward sentiment, the combination creates an intimate atmosphere – either as an ode to a distant lover, or a dedication to the fans in lieu of the hiatus.

description.plain:
“You & I” is the fourth and final single off One Direction’s third album, Midnight Memories. It was released as a single on April 15, 2014.  The song peaked at #68 on Billboard and at #19 on UK Singles Chart. It was certified Silver in the UK.

The music video for the song was released on April 18, 2014 and arose some controversy because it apparently plagiarized the music video of “Everything You Wanted”, from Australian band Clubfeet.

One Direction also had a fragance named after this song:

description.plain:
“Olivia” is the 9th track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. It was leaked along with the majority of the album on November 2nd, 2015 during an early listening party. This song has an “old-school” feel, sounding similar to an old British song with the strings in the audio recorded in Abbey Road. According to band member, Harry Styles, “Olivia” isn’t about a certain person named Olivia, it “could be about a person or place”. Because that’s how nouns work.

Note that “Olivia” is the second One Direction song with a girl’s name on its title, following Midnight Memories‘ “Diana”. Also, although it isn’t on the title, “Best Song Ever” also mentioned a girl’s name.

description.plain:
“A.M.” is the 17th song and a bonus track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. This song is co-written by Julian Bunetta, Ed Drewett, Wayne Hector, John Ryan, Liam Payne, Louis Tomlinson, Niall Horan, and Harry Styles.

This is the only song which credits all four band members as writers, and with a rather straight-forward melody and message it gives the idea of the band sitting around and chatting in the a.m..

In an interview Niall described this song as being “pretty straight-forward”, describing the conversations you may have with your mates after a night out.

description.plain: “Best Song Ever” served as the lead single for One Direction’s third album, Midnight Memories. It was also a promotional single for This Is Us, a 3D movie about the band. The song reached #2 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100, which is the highest chart position that One Direction has ever achieved in that country. It has been certified Platinum in both the US and the UK.

body.plain: “Best Song Ever” served as the lead single for One Direction’s third album, Midnight Memories. It was also a promotional single for This Is Us, a 3D movie about the band. The song reached #2 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100, which is the highest chart position that One Direction has ever achieved in that country. It has been certified Platinum in both the US and the UK.

description.plain:
“What A Feeling” is the 10th track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M. It was leaked with the rest of the album on November 2nd, 2015 after a mishap in security during an early album listening party. In an interview band members, Liam Payne and Louis Tomlinson, said “What A Feeling” is their favourite song on the album.

This song was co-written by Liam Payne, Louis Tomlinson, Daniel Bryer, Mike Needle and Jamie Scott

description.plain:
“Love You Goodbye” is the 11th track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. It was leaked with the rest of the album on November 2nd, 2015 after a mishap in security during an early album listening party.

This song is co-written by Louis Tomlinson, Jacob Kasher Hindlin, and Julian Bunetta. According to Tomlinson in an intro video that played before this song during the early listening party, this song is: “About seeing an ex after you’ve broken up or run into. Rated PG-13ish.”

description.plain:
“Temporary Fix” is the 14th track and one of the bonus songs on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M..

Niall describes the song as detailing a scenario where you would walk into the bar and pick up a girl, with no strings attached. This song is about having friends with benefits, and is modeled after the song “Sex on Fire” by Kings of Leon.

This song is co-written by Niall Horan, Wayne Hector, Thomas Barnes, Peter Kelleher, and Benjamin Kohn.

description.plain:
“Fool’s Gold” is the 6th track from One Direction’s fourth studio album, which was due for release on 17th November 2014, but leaked 9 days earlier.

Fool’s gold, or pyrite, is a common sulfide mineral that looks like gold thanks to its brass-yellow colour, hence the nickname of “fool’s gold”.

description.plain:
“End Of The Day” is the 5th song on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M. It was leaked with the rest of the album on November 2nd, 2015 after a mishap in security during an early album listening party and was officially released on November 13, 2015.

It was co-written by Louis Tomlinson, Liam Payne, Ed Drewett, Gamal Lewis, John Ryan, Julian Bunetta and Wayne Hector.

description.plain:
“Steal My Girl”, was the lead single off the fourth album of One Direction,  Four. The song was released on September 29, 2014, although it was leaked a day before.  “Steal My Girl” has peaked at #3 on UK Singles and at #13 on Billboard Hot 100 and it has been certified Platinum in the UK and Gold in the US.

The track arose some controversy when Chad Gilbert, New Found Glory’s guitarrist, and Hayley Williams, his girlfriend at the time, accused 1D of ripping off NFG’s 2006 song “It’s Not Your Fault”.

description.plain:
“No Control”, the eighth song taken from One Direction’s fourth studio album, was due to be released on 17 November 2014 however, leaked 9 days early.

This song is of a particularly sexual nature when compared with the band’s other songs. This may be what main songwriter, Louis Tomlinson, was alluding to when he described the latest album as “a bit more edgy and mature”.

The boys remain true to their preppy beginnings with an upbeat pop-tempo yet introduce a pounding drumbeat not dissimilar to the likes of Coldplay, whose frontman Chris Martin happens to be a main source of inspiration for the band, according to Harry Styles.

description.plain:
“Walking in the Wind” is the 15th song and a bonus track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. It is written by Julian Bunetta, John Ryan, Harry Styles, and J.S. Baylin.

Harry describes this song as being conversational and informal in nature and is inspired by the album Graceland by one of his personal idols, Paul Simon.

There are various interpretations of this song:


This song could be written as an ode to fans, before One Direction embark on their hiatus.
This song could also be interpreted as a message to former band member, Zayn Malik.
A third interpretation is as a message to an ex-lover, where the breakup is on good terms and Harry hopes to be with them again at a time when they’re better for one another.
This song is also rumored to be about Harry’s grandmother, who passed away in early 2015.



https://twitter.com/thenialls/status/670687627759263744

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Harry]
A week ago you said to me
"Do you believe I'll never be too far?"
If you're lost, just look for me
You'll find me in the region of the summer stars
The fact that we can sit right here and say goodbye
Means we've already won
A necessity for apologies between you and me
Baby, there is none

[Pre-Chorus: Niall]
We had some good times, didn't we?
We had some good tricks up our sleeve
Goodbyes are bitter-sweet
But it's not the end, I'll see your face again

[Chorus: Harry]
You will find me, yeah you will find me
In places that we've never been
For reasons we don't understand
Walking in the wind, walking in the wind

[Verse 2: Louis]
Yesterday I went out
To celebrate the birthday of a friend
But as we raised our glasses up to make a toast
I realised you were missing

[Pre-Chorus: Liam]
We had some good times, didn't we?
We wore our hearts out on our sleeve
Goodbyes are bitter-sweet
But it's not the end, I'll see your face again

[Chorus: Harry]
You will find me, yeah you will find me
In places that we've never been
For reasons we don't understand
Walking in the wind, walking in the wind

[Bridge: Harry]
I know we'll be alright, child
Just close your eyes and see
I'll be by your side
Any time you're needing me, oh yeah

[Chorus: All]
You will find me, yeah you will find me
In places that we've never been
For reasons we don't understand
Walking in the wind, walking in the wind
Walking in the wind

description.plain:
“I Want to Write You A Song” is the 12th song on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M.. It is written by John Ryan, Julian Bunetta, and Ammar Malik.

Interesting fact: Throughout the song the sound of a scribbling pencil was echoed in the background to mimic the idea that as they were thinking about writing a song for their lovers, they wrote this one. Meta!

Everything I need I get from you

One to make your heart remember me
So any time I'm gone, you can listen to my voice and sing along
I wanna write you a song
I wanna write you a song

description.plain:
“Stockholm Syndrome” is the eleventh song taken from One Direction’s fourth studio album. The album was due to be released on the 17th November 2014 however, leaked 9 days early.

Stockholm syndrome, or capture-bonding, is a psychological phenomenon in which hostages express empathy and sympathy and have positive feelings toward their captors, sometimes to the point of defending and identifying with them.

In an interview, Harry Styles, who co-wrote the song, discussed its meaning. After defining “Stockholm Syndrome”, he explained that they applied the idea of the psychological phenomenon to a relationship–“of actually,” as Zayn added, “enjoying the feeling of being trapped,” with Harry clarifying, “to a nympho.” When the interviewer suggested that the song was a reflection of the band “feeling trapped” within their circumstances, Liam dismissed this (decidedly more PG) interpretation, and Harry insisted, “This song was more about, like, a nympho.”

“Nympho” is colloquial shorthand for the term “nymphomaniac,” which is defined as “a woman who has abnormally excessive and uncontrollable sexual desire.”

description.plain:
“Never Enough” is the 8th song on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M. This song was leaked twice, in the form of a hotel video in July 2015, and once again with the majority of the album during an early listening party in November 2015. With trumpets blaring and the band’s occasional grunting, this song is said to have a “jungle” vibe.

This song is co-written by Niall Horan, Julian Bunetta, and John Ryan. Band member Niall cited this as his favorite song off the album stating it was “different from anything [they’ve] ever done”

Musically uptempo, this song is clearly influenced by the contributions of Ladysmith Black Mambazo to Paul Simon’s Graceland.

description.plain:
The titular song off Midnight Memories crashes the relatively tame nature of 1D songs with booming choruses, loud guitar riffs, and rebellious lyrics, co-written by band members Louis and Liam.

“Midnight Memories” is the third single off the album, five days before its release. The track peaked at No. 12 on the US Billboard Hot 100.

description.plain:
“One Thing” was released as the second international/third Great Britain single from One Direction’s debut, Up All Night. It talks about an infatuation with someone who has this “one thing” which is unidentified. It was originally written as two songs before combined into one. The track also has a B-side, “I Should Have Kissed You”, which is featured on special versions of Up All Night.

It reached the top ten in the UK, Ireland, and Scotland, becoming their third consecutive top ten entry in each country. It also reached the top forty in multiple other countries like Australia, Belgium, Canada, Hungary, Slovakia, and the US. The track has been certified Silver in the UK and Platinum in the US.

The boys first performed this song live on Jingle Bell Ball 2011:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NmcWJtLTvcQ

description.plain:
“Wolves” is the 16th song and a bonus track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, “Made in the A.M”. It was leaked along with the rest of this album on November 2nd, 2015, during an early listening party for the album. “Wolves” is a fast paced song, about “when men are eyeing up your girl at the club”. https://twitter.com/idkusuk/status/661321600210440193.
This song is co-written by Will Champlin, Ian Franzino, Andrew Haas, Niall Horan, and Liam Payne.

description.plain:
“Kiss You” – the third single from Take Me Home – is a fast-tempo love ballad describing the feelings of a teenage crush, bringing back the nostalgia of that crush you had in high school.

The music video was released on January 7, 2013 and has gained over 370 million views since its release.

description.plain:
“Long Way Down” is the 7th track on One Direction’s fifth studio album, Made in the A.M. It was leaked with the rest of the album on November 2nd, 2015 after a mishap in security during an early album listening party.

It was co-written by Liam Payne, Louis Tomlinson, Julian Bunetta, John Ryan and Jamie Scott. The song indulges in a slow, dragging melody with subtle sad guitar sounds to recreate the feeling of falling down a long way.

description.plain:
“Live While We’re Young” is the lead single of One Direction’s sophomore effort, Take Me Home.

The song is about having fun and enjoying life before it’s too late. It continues the playfulness of the band’s first album, Up All Night, while still presenting a mature sound.

It peaked at #3 on both US Billboard Hot 100 and UK Official Charts and was certified Gold in the UK and Platinum in the US.

description.plain: “Diana” is the third track that appears on One Direction’s album, Midnight Memories. Lyrically, the song is a tribute to girls who have been through depression or just bad times in general.  However, in an interview, it was revealed that it was not about that and that One Direction had originally wanted to call it “Johanna”.  The name was changed because Louis’s mother is named Johanna.

description.plain:
“Rock Me” is a single from their second album ‘Take Me Home’.

It’s a song not actually written by any of the boys but by a team of writers and producers, including: by Peter Svensson, Sam Hollander, Lukasz Gottwald, Henry Walter, Breanna Smith, and Allan Grigg, with production handled by Dr. Luke, Circut and Kool Kojak.

It peaked at number 1 on the US Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles chart and at 98 on the US Billboard Hot 100.

description.plain:
“Better Than Words” is a song by English-Irish band One Direction. It is featured on their third studio album, Midnight Memories.

The song’s verses are composed completely of song titles by the likes of Maroon 5 and Beyoncé.

In the song, the boys are trying to explain their relationship with a girl, but cannot find the words to because their relationship is so amazing.

description.plain: “More than This” was the fourth single of One Direction’s debut album, Up All Night. A live music video for the song was released on May 10, 2012. Compared to their previous singles, “More Than This” wasn’t very successful, only going top 40 in Ireland and top 50 in Australia.

description.plain:
“Clouds” is the 12th track from One Direction’s fourth studio album, which was due for release on 17th November 2014, but leaked 9 days earlier.

The song is about a relationship that didn’t work out because one person wasn’t as serious about the relationship as the other.

It may also be about the boys' relationship with people or media that doubted that they would succeed or reach the stardom that they did and stay as long as they did, “We’re looking down on the clouds.”

description.plain:
“Don’t Forget Where You Belong” is the 6th single from the band’s third studio album, released on 23 November 2013.

The song moves away from the general uptempo songs the band is used to , towards a more soft-rock, mid-tempo song—appropriate for the band’s transition to a more mature look and feel. This also serves for a nostalgic [yet comforting] feeling, appropriate for the song’s context.

body.plain:
“Don’t Forget Where You Belong” is the 6th single from the band’s third studio album, released on 23 November 2013.

The song moves away from the general uptempo songs the band is used to , towards a more soft-rock, mid-tempo song—appropriate for the band’s transition to a more mature look and feel. This also serves for a nostalgic [yet comforting] feeling, appropriate for the song’s context.

description.plain:
“Up All Night” is the title track on One Direction’s debut of the same name. The boys joyously sing about a party, including girls, Katy Perry songs, and possible property damage.

It was generally well-received by critics. Billboard editor Jason Lipshutz had this to say about the song:

[It] acts as stomping party anthem; “Katy Perry’s on replay,” for goodness sake! Vocal refrain should be intoxicating, but feels a bit too safe.

A live music video for the song was released on April 20, 2012.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x0apWO5n7D0

description.plain:
To continue building up the anticipation of their  fourth studio album due in 11 days, the One Direction boys set their followers and fans on social media a task to unlock this new track for those who pre-ordered the album.

https://twitter.com/onedirection/status/530375990556786688

Of course the Directioners obliterated the set targets and were rewarded with “Ready to Run”.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zrgnfy7OT9w

description.plain: Summer Love is a melancholy, sweet song about a fleeting summer relationship that’s coming to an end now that one person is leaving. It is the thirteenth track on One Direction’s second album, Take Me Home, and continues the album’s themes of love and loss. Unlike several other 1D songs from the era, all of the boys are actually credited with its writing.

description.plain:
“Spaces” is the tenth track on One Direction’s fourth studio album which was due to be released on the 17th November 2014, however leaked 9 days early.

This song, contrasting with many others by One Direction, focuses on the anxieties surrounding strong relationships instead of the pleasures.

Although the tempo is very downbeat, the harmonies and melody bring about a much-needed sense of comfort and hope, further aiding their transition into a more mature sound.

description.plain:
“Change My Mind" is the eighth track on One Direction’s sophomore album, Take Me Home. It is one of the few slow ballads on the album, describing the uncertainty of whether or not to spend the night with one’s potential romantic partner.

A high quality live version of this song was released with One Direction’s movie, This Is Us in 2013.

description.plain:
“Gotta Be You” was released as the second single in Great Britain from One Direction’s debut album Up All Night. The second worldwide/third UK single was “One Thing.” It describes a guy who’s trying to get back together with his girlfriend despite the fact that he broke her heart. This song has a B-side, “Another World”, which is featured on special editions of Up All Night.

It was successful in Great Britain, reaching the top ten in the UK, Ireland, and Scotland. Despite not being released as a single outside of Great Britain, it reached 98 in Italy and 124 in the US.

The boys first performed this song live on The X Factor UK series 8:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y0SUyFeOFUI

description.plain:
“Little Black Dress” is a rock-heavy track that explores a new, sexier situation for One Direction.  The song was a change for One Direction, moving from Midnight Memories‘ signature poprock theme to a track filled with loud electric guitar riffs that could’ve come from late-70s FM radio rock.

This track was recorded completely in a live setting, according to Billboard and features no solos for any of the band, instead primarily featuring a harmony of Louis Tomlinson and Harry Styles for both verses.

description.plain:
“I Wish” is the sixth track from One Direction’s successful debut, Up All Night. Featuring tender “na na na’s” (unlike the ones in “What Makes You Beautiful”), it tells a story of unrequited love.

Billboard’s Jason Liphutz compared this song to Robyn’s “Dancing On My Own”:

Another mid-tempo ode to jealousy in the face of ‘the other man.’ Reminiscent in lyrical tone to Robyn’s “Dancing On My Own,” but even more forlorn.

description.plain: “I Want” is a song by English-Irish boyband One Direction. The song is on their debut album, Up All Night. The track is about a girl who is a gold-digger and is only with her boyfriend for presents and his money. It was written by Tom Fletcher, ex-vocalist and guitarist of McFly. He has also written “I Would” and “Don’t Forget Where You Belong” for One Direction.

description.plain:
The fourteenth track from the ‘Take Me Home’ album by One Direction explores the characteristics of a girl who enjoys attention.
She goes out at night, parties, steals the limelight. This girl seemingly has no fears, except one. She loves scary movies, dressing up how ever she wants & shamelessly, but she is afraid of falling in love.

description.plain:
In “Nobody Compares,” the 1D boys question why a girl they’ve been pursuing is suddenly showing interest in another boy.

The band references cities like London and Paris in the verses, which are locations known for being stylish and romantic, possibly reminding him of her qualities. It’s also quite possible that the boys took their special lady to these cities — they’ve certainly got enough cash to do so!

description.plain:
The song “Illusion” is track fourteen off of One Direction’s album Four.

During a google hangout with the band, Liam Payne confirmed that this song is about his relationship with his (now ex-) girlfriend, Sophia Smith, though he didn’t actually write the song. In the hangout, he joked that Niall had done so, but later clarified that that was a joke and that it was written by long-time 1D collaborator, Julian Bunetta.


There’s a song on the album which is completely about Soph, it’s called “Illusion” and funnily enough, I didn’t write it.

I was having a chat with Julian, we were both talking about our girlfriends and I left him at it and he wrote all the words based on mine and Soph’s relationship. It’s all based on things about us.

description.plain:
“One Way or Another (Teenage Kicks)” is a cover recorded by English-Irish boy band One Direction, released as the 2013 Comic Relief charity single on 17 February 2013. It is a medley of Blondie’s “One Way or Another” (1979) and The Undertones' “Teenage Kicks” (1978). The song was produced by Julian Bunetta and John Ryan.

“One Way or Another (Teenage Kicks)” debuted at number one on the UK Singles Chart; it was  One Direction’s third UK number one hit. It was nominated for Best British Single at the 2014 Brit Awards.

description.plain:
“Tell Me a Lie” appears on One Direction’s debut album, Up All Night. Co-written by American singer-songrwritter Kelly Clarkson, the song deals with the five-some wanting to hear a lie rather than the truth in regards to the reason why their lover is leaving them.

The boys first performed this song live at The Colosseum, Watford, during the Up All Night Tour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WUOkjC61NwI

description.plain: “Stand Up” appears on One Direction’s debut album, Up All Night. Written by Josh Wilkinson and Roy Stride, the song deals with the group attempting to steal a girl’s heart. A “stand up” can be described as a robbery (such as the robbery of a bank), in which an item is intended to be stolen.

description.plain:
After releasing their highly successful lead single from Made In The AM, “Drag Me Down”, 1D return with a Lunchmoney Lewis verse and a new, trap-inspired beat courtesy of Liam Payne, who’s known as Big Payno as a DJ/remixer.

The remix was included on 1D’s Perfect EP, coming in as the fourth track.

description.plain:
The boys try to win back the one that got away in this upbeat song from their 2012 album. The track has a similar theme to “Back For You,” a song in which the boys sing about wanting to get back together with an ex.

Three 1D boys have writing creds on the track: Harry Styles, Louis Tomlinson, and Liam Payne.

The track could also be seen as a play on words of the 1997 track “You’re Still The One” by renowned country singer Shania Twain. Harry Styles has spoken on numerous occasions (even more so recently) about his long-standing appreciation for the singer, even going so far as so cover the song at MSG in his world tour for his debut album.

I think both music and fashion, [my] main influence was probably Shania Twain. I think she’s amazing!

https://twitter.com/harry_styles/status/387385165846437888?lang=en

description.plain: “Na Na Na” is a song by British-Irish boyband One Direction. The track is on select versions of the band’s debut album, Up All Night, available in Australia, New Zealand, Mexico, Germany, and the Philippines. The song is about an on-and-off relationship. It is also the B-side of “What Makes You Beautiful”.

description.plain:
“I Should Have Kissed You” is a song written by
Ina Wroldsen and Steve Robson about 1D’s regret in not jumping at the opportunity to kiss their love interest.

It’s a bonus track number 18 on the Australian, Mexican, Philippines and New Zealand souvenir edition and Japanese edition of the album Up All Night as well as number 16 on the German edition. The song is also the B-side of “One Thing”.

description.plain: “Forever Young” would be One Direction’s winner single had the group won The X Factor UK series 7. It is a cover of Alphaville’s song.As they finished on third place, the boys didn’t have the chance to perform this song live on the program but they performed it on subsequent shows.

description.plain:
One Direction covered “Torn” twice on The X Factor UK series 7: first at the Judges' house and then on the finals of the program. Unfortunately, they were eliminated of the competition and ended on third place.

Five years later, the boyband covered “Torn” again – this time for BBC Radio 1 Lounge and without Zayn, who had already left the group.

songs.lyrics:
Auditions - Free choice:
Harry - "Isn't She Lovely"
Liam - "Cry Me a River"
Louis - "Hey There Delilah"
Niall - "So Sick"
Zayn - "Let Me Love You"

Bootcamp - Dance rounds:
Harry - "Stop Crying Your Heart Out"
Liam - "Stop Crying Your Heart Out"
Louis, Niall, and Zayn - unknown

Judges house - Free choice:
"Torn"

Week 1 (October 9) - Number 1 singles
"Viva La Vida"

Week 2 (October 16) - Heroes
"My Life Would Suck Without You"

Week 3 (October 23) - Guilty Pleasures
"Nobody Knows"

Week 4 (October 30) - Halloween
"Total Eclipse of the Heart"

Week 5 (November 6) - American anthems
"Kids in America"

Week 6 (November 13) - Elton John
"Something About The Way You Look Tonight"

Week 7 (November 20) - The Beatles
"All You Need Is Love"

Week 8 (November 27) - Rock
"Summer of '69"
"You Are So Beautiful"

Semi-finals (Week 9 - December 4) - Club classics/ Songs to get you to the final
"Only Girl (In The World)"
"Chasing Cars"

Final (Week 10 - December 11 and 12) - No theme/ Celebrity duets/ No theme/ Winner's single:

December 11
"Your Song"
"She's The One", featuring Robbie Williams

December 12
"Torn"
Winner's single: "Forever Young", if they had made it to the last two remaining acts

description.plain:
“Perfect (Matoma Remix)” is the third song from from One Direction’s Perfect EP. It premiered on Spotify on October 21, 2015.

Written primarily by Harry, the song is supposedly a response to his former relationship with Taylor Swift.

description.plain: One Direction covered P!nk’s “Nobody Knows” on week 3 of The X Factor UK series 7. The theme of the week was guilty pleasures. Before the performance, it was revealed that this song was their backup option. They had to change songs because coach Simon Cowell wasn’t “feeling it” with their previous pick.

description.plain: Released in late 2011, “Your Maths Skills Are Terrible” is a parody of 1D’s smash single “What Makes You Beautiful.” The song was played on Chris Moyles' Quiz Night. If you follow along with the math, you’ll get a final answer of 130.

songs.lyrics:
[Liam]
You're insecure
So half of four
Your old brains are not what they were before

[Zayn]
Add two threes. It's fun for us
Cause we're young and we can still remember stuff

[Harry]
Everyone else can multiply by sixty
Everyone else can add two

[All]
Now take off one hundred, and add on 24
Then divide by two and add on seven more
And if you're struggling now it's not hard to tell
You don't know, oh, oh, your math skills are terrible

If only you had a mind like me
You'd understand how to divide the sum by three
And then just add on the age of this OAP
You don't know, oh, oh, your math skills are terrible, oh, oh

[Outro]
It's really kind of pitiful

description.plain:
The boys of 1D performed a cover of Kelly Clarkson’s “My Life Would Suck Without You” while competing on the X Factor UK Series 7 in 2010. The theme of the week was “musical heroes”. Harry was not feeling well and had to leave the soundcheck before their performance. He claims he had stage fright. However, it did not seem to affect the group’s actual performance on the show.

The boys first performed this song live outside The X Factor UK on February 9, 2011, at LG Arena, Birmingham, for The X Factor Live Tour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=18H26qaf74c

description.plain:
One Direction covered  Snow Patrol’s “Chasing Cars” on the semi-finals of The X Factor UK series 7. They also performed Rihanna’s “Only Girl (In The World)” on that night as well.

They were mentored by Cheryl Cole on that week because Simon Cowell was sick. The boys also had to rehearse this song without Zayn because of a family emergency. After this performance, Cheryl praised them for their maturity:

This week, I was so impressed. You didn’t have Zayn, Simon wasn’t around… You showed a real level of maturity and you deserve a place on the finals.

The boys have also covered this song live on other occasions. The first time 1D performed this song outside The X Factor UK was at Hall Cross School:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hQodf7bKAUo

songs.lyrics:
Louis and Zayn leave the underground car park as they head to the stadium for the concert:

Minder: Well we got a full chicken.. we can take this to Jamaica, we don’t have anything in Jamaica set up

Unknown male: Are we allowed to talk contraband in this?

Louis: Yes of course. That’s what it’s about... Where’s the lighter? Can anybody pass me a lighter please? I want to light up. You got a lighter?

After much searching, Louis can be seen lighting up and heard coughing

Louis: So here we are, leaving Peru. Joint lit. Happy days... What do you think Zayn? About that kind of content?

Zayn: I think it’s very controversial

Louis sees a police motorbike rider escorting their convoy

Louis: ‘That’s the police. That’s the po po... Nice. I’m trying to blow it into the camera. Smokescreen baby!... That’s just Zayn warming up there before the show. Zayn takes his job very seriously. He makes sure he goes through a two-hour intense warm up regime before every show, just to get himself in the zone. One very, very important factor to Zayn’s warm up, of course is Mary Jane herself. In fact I’m presenting it to him now for some fantastic singing

Louis passes Zayn the roll up cigarette

Louis: How is it Zayn?

Zayn: Nice

Louis: That’s the po po. One nil

Louis starts filming out the window

Louis: Get a bit of the culture. How’s that kind of culture?

Zayn: It’s great culture this. It’s going to be even greater culture when we get to Jamaica

Member of crew: I just got an update. We got chicken in Chile

Zayn: Chicken in Chile! Chile chicken

Louis: Yeh baby. That’s the po po. Two nil

Louis puts on an exaggerated dopey voice and sways the camera around:

Louis: Fucking ‘ell bro, I’m chillin. Oh my God bro. My ‘ed’s a wreck

Louis: It’s green only! Nig!

Louis: I’m just wondering now. I’m sitting here in Peru wondering will this come back to me? Who knows? Maybe, maybe not

Another police bike passes:

Louis: One nil bitch! Look at this bitch... He’s having a look. He’s thinking. I’m sure I can smell an illegal substance in there. And he’s hit the nail on the head

Zayn: Carl showed... me Kid Rock’s last book. And it’s about twice the size. Hard back. Black. Simple writing. No bullshit.No like ‘My favourite colour’s blue.. And all just sick pictures

Louis is passed the roll up by a crew member and zooms in on it:

Louis: Ooo Stubbsy!

Zayn: “Every time you look in it you just think 'fuck I’ve never seen that picture.' That’s a bad photo...instead of boring crap.

Louis: “Yeah I know, same old crap that I’m sure the fans are bored of reading.”

Zayn: "They want to know what we're up to now man."

Talking about the Kid Rock book Zayn says: “He’s smoking a J in one of the pictures Louis and he’s got a gold ring on his middle finger, which is a bid weird, but, aside from that he’s sticking his middle finger up with a J in his mouth, and that's one of the pictures in the book.

Louis: “Sick.”

description.plain:
One Direction covered Joe Cocker’s “You Are So Beautiful” on week 8 of The X Factor UK series 7. The theme of the week was rock. The boys also covered Bryan Adams' “Summer of ‘69” on before this performance.

Coach Simon Cowell defined this song as “challenging” for the group in terms of vocals. Because of that, vocal coach Savan Kotecha explained that the song was stripped down to showcase the boys' vocals. Harry also hoped that this performance would showcase their vocal evolution.

Judge Louis Walsh argued with Simon about the genre of this song. While Louis claimed that it wasn’t really a rock song, Simon pointed out that Joe Cocker was a rock singer.

Simon told the boys how proud of them he was during this performance, especially of Zayn. He remembered that Zayn was really shy and embarassed to sing at the Bootcamp, and said that it was nice to see that confidence in him.

description.plain:
One Direction performed this song live on the Week 1 of The X Factor UK 2010.  The theme of the week was number-one singles. “Viva La Vida”, originally sung by Coldplay, was the band’s first number one single in the UK.

Zayn revealed that he was anxious before the performance because he was off time during the rehearsals with vocal coach Savan Kotecha.

After their performance, judge Louis Walsh (correctly) predicted that 1D had the potential to be the “next big boy band”, but criticized their style. The other judges had positive reviews as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-lINAdS73SI

description.plain:
One Direction covered World Party’s “She’s The One” along with Robbie Williams for the live duet of The X Factor UK series 7 finals. They had already covered Elton John’s “Your Song” on the same night and proceeded to cover Ednaswap’s “Torn” on the last day of the competition.

Robbie Williams had also covered this song for his album I’ve Been Expecting You . The track was released as a single on 1999 and became Robbie’s second number-one song in the UK.

description.plain:
One Direction covered Kim Wilde’s “Kids in America” on week 5 of The X Factor UK series 7. The theme of the week was American anthems. Judge Louis Walsh criticized coach Simon Cowell’s song choice because “Kids in America” wasn’t exactly a hit in the US, peaking at #25 on Billboard Hot 100. Cheryl Cole agreed with Walsh, pointing out that “it’s a great song, but it isn’t American”.

The boys first performed this song live outside The X Factor UK on February 9, 2011, at LG Arena, Birmingham, for The X Factor Live Tour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-pb-zMqFAk0

description.plain:
One Direction covered Rihanna’s “Only Girl (In The World)” on the semi-finals of The X Factor UK series 7. They also performed a cover of Snow Patrol’s “Chasing Cars” on the same night.

Cheryl Cole mentored them for those performances because Simon Cowell was sick. Later on, she said that their cover of “Only Girl” just “didn’t do it” for her and Simon accused her of making “strategies”.

songs.lyrics:
Hey everyone. Saw some signs about me tonight that where a bit upsetting dont know whats happend but i hope I'm good with you guys and I hope you know how grateful I am that you guys have done all of this for us because i genuinely can't believe how lucky I am to be here.

It's amazing that you guys have created all this for us, non of us can believe the stuff that we get to do everyday and it's all down to you guys spending time on here spreading the word about us and being so dedicated spending all your money trying to make it to our shows an stuff.

'Thanks to everyone that has been so far every crowd has litterally been amazing and it's so tough to pick a favourite.'

'Like I said I hope everything’s ok and I know a lot of people may not like me right now and feel a little under appreciated as we dont get to come out and meet u guys all that much i wish it was easier.

'I do truly appreciate you guys tho you have changed my life and i could never thank you enough I hope in time it will all be cool.'

There's a numb in my toes, standing close to the edge
There's a pile of my clothes at the end of your bed
As I feel myself fall, make a joke of it all

description.plain: Included on the Gotta Be You – EP, this remix embraces a widely electronic, synthesised tone. Contrary to the original recording, the tempo is sped up, acoustic aspects are stripped, and replaced with DJ-influenced flares – from the relentless drum beat to vocal embellishments similar in EDM and hip hop genres.

description.plain:
Following success with hit single “Live While We’re Young”, One Direction records a live version of “I Want” from their debut album Up All Night.
Featured in the Live While We’re Young- EP in promotion for their upcoming album Take Me Home,  the track maintains both the heavy instrumental backing and original vocal arrangements as in the studio-recorded version.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Harry]

I should know because I've heard when girls say

I want, I want, I want
